meanings.definition: A member of the lowest order of the British nobility.
meanings.sent1: The baron lived in a big castle.
meanings.sent2: The baron was invited to the royal ball.
meanings.sent3: The baron's hat was too big for his head.
meanings.sent4: In the land of business, he was the baron of success.
meanings.sent5: The baron's title made him feel important.

meanings.definition: A powerful or influential person in a particular industry or field.
meanings.sent1: As a baron of technology, he revolutionized the industry.
meanings.sent2: The media baron controlled multiple news outlets.
meanings.sent3: The fashion baron always wore the trendiest clothes.
meanings.sent4: She was the baron of organization in the office.
meanings.sent5: The music baron's influence reached far and wide.

meanings.definition: A large and imposing house or mansion.
meanings.sent1: The baron's mansion had a grand staircase.
meanings.sent2: Visitors were in awe of the baron's opulent house.
meanings.sent3: The baron's mansion was so big, it had its own cinema.
meanings.sent4: The baron's house stood out with its majestic architecture.
meanings.sent5: The baron's residence was the talk of the town.
